python_runtime_environment.description: Python REPL environment supporting top-level await, including the standard Python built-in libraries as well as the third-party libraries listed in the Intent IR.

object.name: print
object.description: All print output is collected by the system for feedback purposes. Use it exclusively for critical observations, debug messages, or essential status updates. Avoid redundant output, and do not print standalone strings like 'done' or 'complete' to signal completion.

object.name: input
object.description: A BaseModel instance. Its JSON Schema available in the Intent IR. Do not directly print(input).

object.name: tools
object.description: A SimpleNamespace instance. A description of each member is provided in the Intent IR.

object.name: OutputModel
object.description: The output model class (subclass of BaseModel) specifying the required output format. Its JSON Schema is available in the Intent IR. Instantiate the result using this class. Do not redefine or re-import it. Directly use the provided OutputModel.

object.name: output
object.description: A global variable output initialized to None. Set it to an OutputModel instance only after successfully fulfilling and verifying all requirements in the Intent IRâ€”this completes the task. If the task cannot be completed, assign a string explaining the reason to output instead. IMPORTANT: Do NOT assign an error message string to output in your code based on assumptions or predictions. You must wait for execution feedback, observe the actual error/results, and only assign an error string to output after confirming through feedback that the task truly cannot be completed.

constraints.constraint: Do not actively raise or throw exceptions.
Do not create a new asyncio event loop.
Code MUST be split into multiple rounds when operations depend on previous observations. Do NOT cram the entire task into one round.
Every round MUST use print to output key observations, NOT progress messages like "done" or "completed".
